p: Disulfiram ( 47, Fig. 8 ) is an FDA drug and has been used in alcohol aversion therapy. This drug was reported to inhibit the activity of methyltransferase [93], kinase [94], and urease [94], all by reacting with cysteine residues, suggesting broad-spectrum characteristics [95]. Notably, disulfiram ( 47) has been reported as an allosteric inhibitor of MERS-CoV PL pro [95]. It was suggested that the administration of 41 together with compound 44 and/or 45, could synergistically inhibit MERS-CoV papain-like protease [95].
